SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Serve Home Page Content to Search Engine Bots More Efficiently

To make it easier for search engine bots to crawl and index your Home page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now serves a bot-enabled Home page. Also, the Home page canonical URL is simplified. These changes improve the efficiency of search engine bots crawling your storefront, which ultimately helps boost your storefront's search ranking.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Because previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce didn't serve a bot-enabled Home page, search engine bots tried crawling the standard, asynchronously loaded Home page. As a result, content on your Home page could be cloaked: bots could have indexed a version of your Home page with different content than what human users saw.

In addition, the Home page canonical URL previously included the page name:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/StorefrontName/ccrz__HomePage" />

Since ccrz__HomePage is defined as your Experience Cloud site's Home page, the URL https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore also resolved to the same page as https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__HomePage.

To simplify the canonical URL presented to search engines, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now removes the page name from the Home page URL.

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/StorefrontName?cclcl=en_US" />
NOTE The addition of the cclcl parameter is the result of another change in this release to add the storefront guest user's locale to all canonical URLs.

How: When you upgrade the managed package and enable bot detection, the bot-enabled Home page is available immediately. No extra setup is necessary.

To use the new canonical URL, set the Enable Canonical and Alternate Language Links storefront configuration setting to TRUE. This setting is available under the User Interface module.

(Google Search Console) Cloaking

title: Improving B2B Commerce Search Engine Optimization
